row.column: Field Services Guide This guide includes information about the following submodules of the Service module: Service Management, Equipment Management, and Route Management. The Service Management module includes basic functionality for managing service-related activities, such as entering service orders of various types, creating the appointments of service orders, fulfilling appointments and service orders, and generating invoices for customers. The Equipment Management module includes basic functionality for managing equipment of organizations and customer’s equipment. In this module, you can process customers’ contracts on recurring service delivery,—that is enter service contract information, create schedules for the service delivery, and generate service orders for the contracts. The Route Management module provides the functionality for managing route executed by companies. Through the Route Management module, drivers and a vehicles can be added and assigned to execute routes according to the required skills of the route. For a route, the module also lets reorganize the scheduled appointments by adding, deleting or moving them, as well as changing the order of the appointments. A generated route will give you useful statistics like driving time and distance, that will help you make better decisions to optimize your business management. row.PlainText: Service Management The Service Management module, a part of the Service suite, includes basic functionality you can use to manage service-related activities, such as entering service orders of various types, creating the appointments of service orders, fulfilling appointments and service orders, and generating invoices for customers. The Service Management module is integrated with the financial modules, as well as with the Inventory, Sales Orders, and Customer Management modules. This part of the Field Services Guide contains all the information you need to configure and use the Service Management module. In This Part of the Guide OverviewConfigurationManaging Staff MembersManaging CustomersManaging ServicesManaging Resource EquipmentProcessing Service OrdersService Management Use CasesService Management Form ReferenceService Management Reports

row.column: Overview By using the service management functionality, you can effectively manage the entire lifecycle of the service orders of your company. That is, you can maintain information about the services that your company provides, the service orders and appointments, and the staff members who perform services (including their work schedules, skills, and licenses). With the automation features, reporting options, and integration with the financial, inventory, order management, and customer management functionality, the service management functional area of Acumatica ERP streamlines the entire service process. The primary features of the service management functionality are described briefly below. Easy Maintenance of Staff Member Details In Acumatica ERP, you can enter and store professional information about each employee, such as the employee's skills, the licenses that grant the employee permission to perform certain kinds of work, the geographical areas where the employee can work, and the employee's work schedules. The system provides tools that use this information to help you quickly and easily select the right person to deliver your services. For more information about these capabilities, see Managing Staff Members. Service Scheduling and Dispatching Once you get an inbound call from a customer, you can quickly capture service needs and access customer, history, and resource information to shorten the time between the receipt of this call and the assignment of the service. By using the calendar boards, you can match services to the best available resources and schedule appointments; if required, you can also generate work orders. You can manage daily or weekly schedules automatically or manually, depending on your business needs. The scheduling functionality is described in Appointment Scheduling Options. Flexible Billing Settings In Field Services functional area of Acumatica ERP, invoice generation is based on billing cycles, so you can select different options for billing of different customers. You can assign a customer one billing cycle to generate documents with the same level of information for each service order, or you can specify multiple billing cycles for a customer to generate different documents for different types of service orders. Details on billing cycles are described in the following topics: Billing Cycle SettingsExamples of Billing CyclesIntegration with Other Areas You can process the sales of stock items and services performed on the sold items together, to effectively manage services without reentering pricing and discount information. You create a sales order with services and process the work on services in the Service Management functional area. For details, see Integration of Sales Orders and Service Orders. If a service order requires parts that are not in inventory, you can direct the system to create a purchase order and indicate parts as waiting for delivery. Once the parts are received, the service order will be updated automatically and appointments can be created for the service order. In the following figure, you can see the flow of documents in the Service Management module. Document flow in Service Management Integration with the Equipment Management In Acumatica ERP, you can easily manage and store information on the equipment used for service orders as well as track all information about equipment that needs to be serviced and equipment that can be used for providing services. You can select the equipment by the type needed for the service and assign the equipment to a service order if necessary, and you can track information on equipment, including appointments where it was used. Other Features and Options Service defaults and overrides Parts and inventory management Route management integration Customer management integration Bing Maps integration Mobile service management (Android and iOS)

This topic covers the prerequisites and the preparatory steps you should perform before you begin configuring the Service Management module. ==Prerequisites and Dependencies== The initial system configuration must be completed and the General Ledger module must be configured before you implement the Service Management module. The Service Management module can be tightly integrated with the following Acumatica ERP modules: Accounts Payable, Account Receivable, Sales Orders, and Customer Management. These modules do not require any change in their configuration when the Service Management module is implemented; however, the modules to be integrated with the Service Management module should be implemented first. ==Preparation== This section covers the needed preparation before you begin the basic configuration of the Service Management module. {br}
Preparation for the basic configuration consists primarily of researching how your company will manage the service appointments and where and how the invoices will be generated to customers for the service delivery. You will also gather other service-related information and review settings on various system forms. Configuration Flow This topic describes the process of configuring the basic functionality of the Service Management module, based on the information you have compiled during preparation. Due to dependencies among the forms, the sequence of actions during configuration is critical, so please note instructions about the order in which the steps should be performed. No. Action Description 1 Define auto-numbering sequences Use the ([~/?ScreenId=CS201010|CS201010]) Numbering Sequences (CS201010) form to create new numbering sequences for the following: Service orders Employee schedules Posting batches Equipment (if needed) Licenses (if needed) 2 Create General Ledger accounts Use the ([~/?ScreenId=GL202500|GL202500]) Chart of Accounts (GL202500) form to add any needed General Ledger accounts identified during preparation. For details, see To Add an Account to the Chart of Accounts. 3 Create subaccount segment values Use the ([~/?ScreenId=CS203000|CS203000]) Segment Values (CS203000) form in the Common Settings module to enter the allowed values for segments of the subaccounts. This step is necessary if you use subaccounts in your company and the Subaccount feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form. 4 Create General Ledger subaccounts Use the ([~/?ScreenId=GL203000|GL203000]) Subaccounts (GL203000) form to create subaccounts if they are used in your company. See To Add a Subaccount for more information. This step should be done after Step 3 has been completed. 5 Set up the work calendars Use the ([~/?ScreenId=CS209000|CS209000]) Work Calendar (CS209000) form to set up each work calendar to be used in the Service Management module. On the Calendar Settings tab, specify the work days and the work time for each day. Indicate any unpaid break time during the work day, so that if your company has a 9-hour work day with an hour off for lunch, the system calculates 8 paid hours. On the Exceptions tab, specify holidays, to define when holiday pay instead of regular pay must be paid to employees who work on those days. 6 Configure Service Management preferences Use the ([~/?ScreenId=FS100100|FS100100]) Service Management Preferences (FS100100) form to configure the Service Management module. In the Setup and Numbering Options section of the General Settings tab, specify the following settings, based on the decisions you made during preparation and the auto-numbering sequences you defined: Calendar ID Staff Schedule Numbering Sequence License Numbering Sequence if a numbering sequence is used for licenses and certifications Equipment Numbering Sequence if a numbering sequence is used for equipment created in the Equipment Management module Posting Batch Numbering Sequence Also, select or clear the following check boxes: Require Branch Location in Staff Schedules : Select this check box if you want the branch location setting to be mandatory on the Staff Schedule Rules (FS4010PL) form. Allow Creation of Appointments in the Past : Select this check box if you want to be able to schedule appointments and service orders that occurred in the past. Enable Rooms : Select this check box if you decided during the preparation phase to manage rooms. For more information, see ([~/?ScreenId=FS203500|FS203500]) Rooms(FS203500). Manage Multiple Billing Options per Customer : Select this check box if you decided to allow multiple billing options for each customer, based on the service order type. For more information, see Billing Cycle Settings. In the Default Values section of the General Settings tab, for each service order type, select from which of the following sources the default appointment and service order addresses for invoices will be taken: Business Account , Customer Contact (the Require Contact check box must be selected), or Branch Location . Also, depending on what you have decided during preparation, select the appropriate check boxes in the Times & Expenses Integration section. 7 Create service order types Use the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types (FS202300) form to create the service order types to suit your service processes. Do the following for every service order type you want to create: Type the identifier in the Service Order Type box. Select the numbering sequence in the Service Order Numbering ID box Enter a description in the Description box. Select one of the following in the Behavior box: Quote , Internal , or Regular . In the Take Address and Contact Info from box, select one of the following: Business Account , Customer Contact , or Branch Location . In the Create Invoice In box, select one of the following settings to represent the module in which invoices should be created for services of this type: Accounts Receivable , Sales Orders , or None . If you have specified Accounts Receivable in the Create Invoice In box, do the following: If you want documents with a negative balance to be created, select the Create a Bill Document in AP for Negative Balances check box. These documents will be created in the Accounts Payable module. Select the appropriate credit terms in the Default Terms for AR and SO box. In the Use Sales Account from box, select one of the following: Customer/Vendor Location : For invoices created in the Accounts Receivable module, the account will be taken from the customer location's sales account. For invoices created in the Accounts Payable module, the account will be taken from the vendor location's expense account. Warehouse : For invoices created in the Accounts Receivable module, the account will be taken from the warehouse's sales account. For invoices created in the Accounts Payable module, the account will be taken from the warehouse's expense account. This option appears on the form only if the Multiple Warehouses feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form. Posting Class : For invoices created in the Accounts Receivable module, the account will be taken from the sales account of the posting class. For invoices created in the Accounts Payable module, the account will be taken from the expense account of the posting class. Inventory Item : For invoices created in the Accounts Receivable module, the account will be taken from the stock item or non-stock item's sales account. For invoices created in the Accounts Payable module, the account will be taken from the non-stock item's expense account. If you have specified Sales Orders in the Create Invoice In box, do the following: Select the Order Type for Invoice . The Enable Field Services Integration check box has to be selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO201000) form for the order types to be selected in this box. Select the Order Type for Negative Balance Invoice . The Enable Field Services Integration check box has to be selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO201000) form for the order types to be selected in this box. Select the appropriate credit terms in the Default Terms for AR and SO box. In the Use Sales Account from box, select one of the following options: Customer/Vendor Location : The account will be taken from the customer location's sales account for invoices. Warehouse : The account will be taken from the warehouse's sales account. This option appears on the form only if the Multiple Warehouses feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form. Posting Class : The account will be taken from the sales account of the posting class. Inventory Item : The account will be taken from the stock item or non-stock item's sales account for invoices. Specify Combine Sales Subaccount from , if applicable. This box is available only if the Subaccounts feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form. In the General Subaccount box, specify the general subaccount of the service order type. This box is available only if the Subaccounts feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form. Select the Generation of Invoices Requires Appointments to Be Closed check box to make it possible to generate invoices only if appointments are completed or closed. Depending on what you have decided during preparation, specify the necessary information in the Times & Expenses Integration section. For details, see Service Order Types. 11 Create workflow stages If you decided during the preparation phase to use workflow stages, use the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202100|FS202100]) Workflow Stages (FS202100) form to create the workflow stages and specify their allowed and denied actions. 12 Create branch locations Use the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202500|FS202500]) Branch Locations (FS202500) form to enter general information about each branch location for the branches of your company. Enter the following settings for each branch location: Branch Location ID Description Main Contact Main Address Financial Settings Inventory Defaults 13 Create billing cycles Use the ([~/?ScreenId=FS206000|FS206000]) Billing Cycles (FS206000) form to create the billing cycles you have planned. For details, see Billing Cycle Settings. 14 Enter customers' information Enter customers with the appropriate settings. For details, see Managing Customers. If your organization has only a few customers, enter the information manually; otherwise, create an import scenario. For details on importing data, see Simplified Scenarios for Data Import. Do the following on the ([~/?ScreenId=AR303000|AR303000]) Customers (AR303000) form for each customer: Select or clear the Allow Appointment Notifications check box, depending on the customer's preferences. If you have cleared the Manage Multiple Billing Options per Customer check box on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS100100|FS100100]) Service Management Preferences (FS100100) form, specify the following settings: Billing Cycle ID If applicable, Send Invoices to ( Default Customer Location or Specific Customer Location ) If you have selected the Manage Multiple Billing Options per Customer check box on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS100100|FS100100]) Service Management Preferences form, specify the following settings on the Service Billing tab: Service Order Type Billing Cycle ID If applicable, Send Invoices to ( Default Customer Location or Specific Customer Location ) If applicable, Frequency Type ( Weekly , Monthly , or None ) 15 Configure employees On the ([~/?ScreenId=EP203000|EP203000]) Employees (EP203000) form, create new employees and make them staff members. Alternatively, you can set up existing employees as staff members on the ([~/?ScreenId=EP203000|EP203000]) Employees (EP203000) or ([~/?ScreenId=FS205500|FS205500]) Staff (FS205500) form. For details, see Staff Members. 16 Create skills If you have decided during the preparation phase to use skills, create the skills on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS200600|FS200600]) Skills (FS206000) form. For details, see Skills. 17 Create license and certification types If you have decided during the preparation phase to use license types, create these on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS200900|FS200900]) License Types (FS200900) form. For details, see Licenses. 18 Create service areas If you have decided during the preparation phase to use service areas, create the service areas on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS201900|FS201900]) Service Areas (FS201900) form. For details, see Service Areas. 19 Create staff schedule rules On the Staff Schedule Rules (FS4010PL) form, create staff schedule rules. For details, see Staff Schedules. Remember that for the schedule rules to take effect, the rules need to be generated. 20 Configure vendors On the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors (AP303000) form, create new vendors and make them staff members. Alternatively, you can set up existing vendors as staff members on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors form or ([~/?ScreenId=FS205500|FS205500]) Staff (FS205500) form. For details, see Staff Members. 21 Configure service class On the ([~/?ScreenId=IN201000|IN201000]) Item Classes (IN201000) form, configure the service classes you have planned. For details on the service classes, see Service Classes. Steps 22–28 should be done after Steps 1–21 have been completed. 22 Review the customer and vendor location master records If you have decided to use Customer/Vendor Location in the Use Sales Account from box on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types form as the source for accounts, review the Sales Account box on the GL Accounts tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=AR303000|AR303000]) Customers (AR303000) form for each customer and the Expense Account box on the GL Accounts tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors (AP303000) form. If you have the Business Account Locations feature enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, review the Sales Account box on the GL Accounts tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=AR303020|AR303020]) Customer Locations (AR303020) form and the Expense Account box on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303010|AP303010]) Vendor Locations (AP303010) form. 23 Review the stock item and non-stock item master records If you have decided to use Inventory Items in the Use Sales Account from box on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types form as the source for accounts, review the Sales Account box on the GL Accounts tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items (IN202000) form and, if applicable, the Sales Account box on the GL Accounts tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202500|IN202500]) Stock Items (IN202500) form for the equipment used during an appointment. 24 Review the branch location master records If you have decided to use Branch Location as the source for subaccounts in the Combine Sales Sub. from box on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types form, review the branch location settings in the General Subaccount box on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202500|FS202500]) Branch Locations form. 25 Review the branch master records If you have decided to use Branch as the source for subaccounts in the Combine Sales Sub. from box on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types form, review the branch settings in the Sales Sub. box on the GL Accounts tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=CS102000|CS102000]) Branches (CS102000) form. 26 Review the stock item and non-stock item master records If you have decided to use Inventory as the source for subaccounts in the Combine Sales Sub. from box on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types form, review the Sales Sub. box on the GL Accounts tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items form; and if applicable, the Sales Sub. box on the GL Accounts tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202500|IN202500]) Stock Itemsform for the appointment's inventory items. 27 Review the customer location master records If you have decided to use Customer Location as the source for subaccounts in the Combine Sales Sub. from box on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types form, review the Sales Sub. box on the GL Accounts tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=AR303000|AR303000]) Customers (AR303000) form. If you have the Business Account Locations feature enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form, review the Sales Sub. box on the GL Accounts tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=AR303020|AR303020]) Customer Locations form. 28 Review the service order type master records If you have decided to use Service Order Type as the source for subaccounts in the Combine Sales Sub. from box on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types form, review the Subaccount box for each service order type on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types (FS202300) form.

Service Order Types In Acumatica ERP, service order types are used to define the general settings for service orders and appointments associated with the particular type. In this topic, you will read about creating service order types and specifying their main settings during creation. Creating a Service Order Type You create a service order type on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types (FS202300) form. For each service order type, you specify the following: The numbering sequence to be used for the reference numbers of orders of the type The behavior of the type, which determines the availability of certain form elements for service orders and appointments of the type General settings Default settings of service orders and appointments of the type Billing settings (that is, the settings related to billing customers for service orders of the type) Settings that affect integration between appointments of the type and forms in the system that track the time that staff members spend on attending appointments or performing services These types of settings are described in the sections of this topic. You can specify additional settings for the service order type, such as problem codes, attributes, mailing settings, and time preferences for the ([~/?ScreenId=FS300200|FS300200]) Appointments (FS300200) form for appointments of this type. Also, you can configure quick processing for the service order type so that users can process the service orders and appointments of this type with just one click. For details, see Configuration of Quick Processing. Selecting a Behavior Depending on the behavior you select for the service order type, the system makes particular boxes and tabs available or unavailable on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types, ([~/?ScreenId=FS300100|FS300100]) Service Orders (FS300100), and ([~/?ScreenId=FS300200|FS300200]) Appointments (FS300200) forms. You can select one of the following behaviors for the service order type: Regular : You select this behavior if service orders of the type will include the usual services, such as repair, maintenance, installation, and training. For this behavior, you can set up all the settings except the route-related settings. Route : You select this behavior if service orders of the type include details of the route between locations where services are performed. For the service order types with this behavior, the route can be specified on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS300200|FS300200]) Appointments form. For details on routes, see the Managing Routes chapter in the Route Management guide. Internal : You select this behavior for a type that includes service orders of your own company, and appointments take place inside the company. Because there is no customer involved with the service orders of the type with this behavior, the posting, customer, and route settings are unavailable for the service orders of this type. Quote : You select this behavior a type designed for quotes (which can be converted into service orders if the customer agrees to the quote). For types with this behavior, posting settings are unavailable on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types form. Specifying the Default Settings For appointments of the service order type, you can define the default source of the address for the appointment, which is specified in documents related to the appointment. In the Default Settings section on the Preferences tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types form, in the Take Address and Contact Information From box, you select one of the following options: Business Account : Select this button when the appointments of the type generally take place at the main address—that is, the address that is specified in the Main Address section on the General Info tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=AR303000|AR303000]) Customers (AR303000) form. Contact : Select this button when the appointments of the type generally take place at the address of the customer's contact person—that is, at the address that is specified in the Address section on the General Info tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=FS300200|FS300200]) Appointments form. Branch Location : Select this button when the appointments of this type generally take place at the address of your branch location—that is, at the address that is specified for the branch location in the Main Address section of the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202500|FS202500]) Branch Locations (FS202500) form. Also, in the Default Settings section, you can specify a salesperson that will be assigned by default to the service orders and appointments of the type and whether the commission is paid to this salesperson or not. Specifying the Invoice Generation Settings The invoice generation settings define the type of the documents for customer billing that are generated for appointments or service orders of the service order type, and the general settings for these documents. You specify these settings in the Invoice Generation Settings section of the Preferences tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types form. You select the billing document as follows: If you need to generate a billing document for services (of the service order type) only, you select the Accounts Receivable option button under Generate Invoices In . With this option selected, the system generates an accounts receivable invoice when a user invokes document generation for a service order or appointment. The invoice can then be processed and the payment collected. If the Create a Bill Document in AP for Negative Balances check box (which is available if you select this option button) is selected, for the service order or appointment with a negative balance, the system instead creates an accounts payable bill. If you need to generate a billing document for both services (of the service order type) and inventory items (which may involve shipping) that were sold to customers along with the services, you select the Sales Orders option button under Generate Invoices In . With this option selected, the system initially generates a sales order when a user invokes invoice generation. Optionally, you can create shipments and add freight costs for the sales order. You then generate the invoice. If you have configured quick processing for the service order type, the invoice can be generated automatically along with the sales order. For details about quick processing, see Quick Processing of Service Orders and Appointments. Integration with field services has to be enabled for the sales order type so that you can generate sales orders from forms related to field services. That is, the Enable Field Services Integration check box has to be selected for the necessary order type on the General Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO201000|SO201000]) Order Types (SO201000) form. If you need to generate a billing document for both services (of the service order type) and inventory items (which do not involve shipping) that were sold to customers along with the services, you select the SO Invoice option button under Generate Invoices In . With this option selected, the system initially generates an SO invoice when a user invokes invoice generation. If you have configured quick processing for the service order type, the invoice can be processed automatically in the system. If you do not need to generate invoices for the customer for services of the service order type, you select the None option button under Generate Invoices In group. When you have selected the option button, you specify the default settings for it (also in the Invoice Generation Settings section) to be used in the invoice documents. Setting Up the Time & Expenses Integration In the Time & Expenses Integration section of the Preferences tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types (FS202300) form, you can set up integration with the forms on which time activities are tracked for the service order type if the Enable Time & Expenses Integration check box is selected in the Integrating with Time & Expenses section on the General Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=FS100100|FS100100]) Service Management Preferences (FS100100) form. You need to select the Require Time Approval to Close Appointments check box if you want to set up approval (by an employee with this responsibility) of the time spent performing services of the type. In this section, you can also select the Automatically Create Time Activities from Appointments check box to set up the automatic creation of time activities; you have to also specify the default earning type for the time activities. For details, see Integration with Time & Expenses. Specifying Attributes for Service Orders, Appointments, and Service Contract Schedules An attribute is a site-defined property (for instance, industry or problem type) that gives users the ability to specify information for objects in the system beyond the preconfigured settings on the data entry forms. In the settings of a service order type, you can specify attributes for the classification of service orders, appointments, and service schedules. The applicable set of attributes is specified for a particular service order type on the Attributes tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types (FS202300) form. On this tab, you can select attributes only if they have already been defined in the system. If you need an attribute that has not been defined in the system, you can use the ([~/?ScreenId=CS205000|CS205000]) Attributes (CS205000) form to create the attribute. Then you will be able to select the new attribute for any service order type. The attributes you specify on this tab will be listed for service orders and appointments of this service order type on the Attributes tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=FS300100|FS300100]) Service Orders (FS300100) and ([~/?ScreenId=FS300200|FS300200]) Appointments (FS300200) forms, respectively. The system also copies the active attributes on this tab to the service schedules of this service order type on the Attributes tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=FS305100|FS305100]) Service Contract Schedules (FS305100) and ([~/?ScreenId=FS305600|FS305600]) Route Service Contract Schedules (FS305600) forms. On the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types form, you can specify whether each attribute of the service order type is required. When creating a service order, appointment, or service schedule of the service order type, the user must specify values for all the required attributes. Also, you can specify default values for any attributes of the type; users can overwrite these values for a particular service order, appointment, or service schedule of the type. You can deactivate an obsolete attribute for service orders and appointments of a particular type by clearing the Active check box on this tab. If you do, the deactivated attribute will no longer be displayed for the service orders, appointments, and service schedules of the type, but all attribute values that have already been specified for existing service orders, appointments, and service schedules will still be stored in the database. If you re-activate the attribute, its values (where specified) will become visible in the system again. However, if it is not necessary to preserve the data related to an obsolete attribute, you can deactivate the attribute and then delete it by using the Delete Row button on the table toolbar. In this case, the attribute will be permanently deleted from the service order type, and all attribute values will be deleted from the database. Configuration of Quick Processing In Acumatica ERP, you can simplify the standard multi-step processing of service orders and appointments, and configure quick processing for a particular service order type so that users can process the service orders and appointments of this type with just one click. In this topic, you will read about the configuration of quick processing of service orders and appointments. Configuring Quick Processing for a Service Order Type For quick processing to be used for service orders and appointments of a particular service order type, you must allow quick processing for this service order type and specify the actions to be performed during quick processing. To allow quick processing for the service order type, you select the Allow Quick Process check box on the Preferences tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types (FS202300) form. This causes the Quick Process Settings tab to appear on the form. On this tab, you configure the set of processing actions to be used by default for service orders and appointments of this type. For each particular service order or appointment of the type being processed on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS300100|FS300100]) Service Orders (FS300100) or ([~/?ScreenId=FS300200|FS300200]) Appointments (FS300200) form, the list of actions to be performed can be changed. For instructions on configuring an order type for quick processing, see To Configure Quick Processing for a Service Order Type. Quick processing can be configured for service order types that are defined to initially generate sales orders from service orders or appointments (that is, the Sales Orders option button is selected in the Generate Invoices From section of the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types form). Also, the service order lines that are marked for purchasing—that is, those with the Mark for PO check box selected on the Services or Inventory Item tab or both of the ([~/?ScreenId=FS300100|FS300100]) Service Orders form—are excluded from quick processing because the creation of a purchase order is not included in the quick processing configuration flow. To Create a Service Order Type You create a service order type and provide the settings related to the service order type on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types (FS202300) form. To open any form, you can navigate to it or search for it (by its name or by its form ID without periods). For more information about search capabilities, see Search in the Modern UI. To Create a Service Order Type Open the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types (FS202300) form by searching for or navigating to it. In the Service Order Type box, specify the identifier of the new service order type. In the Description box, specify a brief description of the new type. In the General Settings section of the Preferences tab, do the following: In the Numbering Sequence box, select the numbering sequence to be used for the automatic generation of reference numbers for documents of the service order type. In the Behavior box, select the behavior (category) of the service order type as follows: If the service orders of the type will include the usual services—such as repair, maintenance, installation, and training—select Regular . If the service orders of the type will include details of the route between locations where services are performed, select Route . If the service orders of the type are for your own company, and appointments take place inside the company, select Internal . If the service orders of the type are quotes (documents that can be converted into service orders if the customer agrees to the quote), select Quote , If you do not want the system to complete service orders when their appointments are completed, clear the Complete Service Order When Its Appointments Are Completed check box. If you do not want the system to close service orders when their appointments are closed, clear the Close Service Order When Its Appointments Are Closed check box. In the Default Settings section, do the following: In the Take Address and Contact Information From Section box, select the source of the appointment address and contact as follows: If the address is the main address of the customer for which the service is provided, select Business Account . If the address is the address of the customer's contact person, select Contact . If the address is the address of the branch location that provides the service, select Branch Location . Optional: To set up the system to assign a salesperson to the service orders and appointments of the type by default, in the Salesperson ID box, specify the salesperson. Optional: To set up the system to pay a commission to the salesperson on services or inventory items related to a service order or appointment of the type by default, select the Commissionable check box. If the behavior of the service order type is Regular or Route , in the Invoice Generation Settings section, do the following: Under Generate Invoices In , select the option button corresponding to the billing document to be generated from a service order or appointment of this type as follows: To generate an AR invoice, select Accounts Receivable . To generate a sales order, select Sales Orders . To generate a SO invoice, select SO Invoice . To not generate any billing document, select None . If you selected the Accounts Receivable option button, to specify the settings for document generation, do the following: If the system has to create an AP bill for a service order or appointment with a negative balance, select the Create a Bill Document in AP for Negative Balances check box. In the Default Terms for AR and SO box, select the credit terms that are used when the system generates an AR invoice or credit memo if the customer has no default terms defined. If the Create a Bill Document in AP for Negative Balances check box is selected, in the Default Terms for AP box, select the credit terms that are used when the system generates an AP bill if the vendor has no default terms defined. In the Use Sales Account From box, select the source of the sales account used for the transaction as follows: To use the stock item or non-stock item's sales account when the system generates a document, select Inventory Item . To use the warehouse's sales account when the system generates a document, select Warehouse . To use the sales account of the posting class when the system generates a document, select Posting Class . To use the customer location's sales account when the system generates a document, select Customer/Vendor Location . To specify the rule of composing the subaccount from other associated subaccounts, in the Combine Sales Sub. From box, select a segment, press F3, and select the source of the segment value Optional: In the General Subaccount box, select the sales subaccount used for the service order type. If you selected the Sales Orders option button, to specify the settings for document generation, do the following: To give users the ability to quick process the service orders and appointments of this type, select the Allow Quick Process check box. The Quick Processing tab appears, on which you can configure quick processing (as described in To Configure Quick Processing for a Service Order Type). In the Order Type for Invoice box, select the default sales order type that is used when the system generates sales orders for service orders and appointments with a positive balance. In the Order Type for Negative Balance Invoice box, select the default order type that is used when the system generates sales orders for service order documents with a negative balance. In the Order Type for Allocations box, select the default order type that is used when the system generates sales orders for service order documents with allocated items. In the Default Terms for AR and SO box, select the credit terms that are used when the system generates a sales order if the customer has no default terms defined. If you selected the SO Invoice option button, to specify the settings for document generation, do the following: To give users the ability to quick process the service orders and appointments of this type, select the Allow Quick Process check box. The Quick Processing tab appears, on which you can configure quick processing (as described in To Configure Quick Processing for a Service Order Type). In the Order Type for Allocations box, select the default order type that is used when the system generates sales orders for service order documents with allocated items. In the Default Terms for AR and SO box, select the credit terms that are used when the system generates a SO invoice if the customer has no default terms defined. In the Use Sales Account From box, select the source of the sales account used for the transaction as follows: To use the stock item or non-stock item's sales account when the system generates a document, select Inventory Item . To use the warehouse's sales account when the system generates a document, select Warehouse . To use the sales account of the posting class when the system generates a document, select Posting Class . To use the customer location's sales account when the system generates a document, select Customer/Vendor Location . To specify the rule of composing the subaccount from other associated subaccounts, in the Combine Sales Sub. From box, select a segment, press F3, and select the source of the segment value. Optional: In the General Subaccount box, select the sales subaccount used for the service order type. To set up the system to create a document only if the appointment of the service order type has the Closed status, select the Require Appointment Closing for Invoice Generation check box. Save the service order type. Notes About the Procedure The notes in this section describe the nuances of the UI elements available on the form, such as when an element is required and when it is not, and when the system fills in settings by default. This section can include other notes. Note that in the Take Address and Contact Information From Section box of the Default Settings section, you can select Contact only if the Require Contact check box is selected in the General Settings section. The Take Address and Contact Information From Section box is not available if Internal is selected in the Behavior box. Note the following about the Invoice Generation Settings section: The section appears only if Regular or Route is selected in the Behavior box. The Allow Quick Process check box appears on the form only if the Sales Orders or SO Invoice option button is selected under Generate Invoices In . In the Use Sales Account From box of the Invoice Generation Settings section, the Warehouse option is available only if the Multiple Warehouses feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form. The Combine Sales Sub. From and General Subaccount boxes are available only if the Subaccounts feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form.

To Configure Quick Processing for a Service Order Type In Acumatica ERP, you can simplify multi-step processing of service orders and appointments of a particular service order type by configuring quick processing for this order type on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types (FS202300) form. You can configure quick processing for a service orders type only if the Sales Orders or SO Invoice option button is selected under Generate Invoices In on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types form. You can search for a form by its name or its form ID (without periods). For more information about search capabilities, see Search in the Modern UI. To Configure Quick Processing for a Service Order Type Open the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types (FS202300) form by searching for or navigating to it. In the Service Order Type box in the Summary area, select the identifier of the service order type for which you want to allow quick processing. On the Preferences tab, select the Allow Quick Process check box. On the Quick Process Settings tab, which appears on the form, do the following to specify the settings that determine which steps the system will perform when a user is quickly processing a service order or appointment of this type: In the Appointment Actions section: Select the Send Email with Signed Appointment check box if the system should send the report with the completed appointment, which was signed with customer by using the mobile application, by email during quick processing. Select the Generate Invoice check box if during quick processing, the system must generate a sales order (for which an invoice will later be generated) for the completed appointment for customers whose billing cycle is set to generate invoices from appointments. In the Service Order Actions section: Select the Complete Order check box if the system must complete the service order during quick processing. Select the Close Order check box if the system must close the service order during quick processing. Select the Generate Invoice check box if during quick processing, the system must generate a sales order for the service order for customers whose billing cycle is set to generate invoices from service orders. If the Sales Orders option button is selected under Generate Invoices In on the Preferences tab, in the Sales Order Actions section: Select the Prepare Invoice check box if during quick processing, the system must create an invoice for the sales order generated for the service order or appointment. Select the Use Sales Order Quick Processing check box if the system must process the generated sales order by using the quick processing settings specified for the type of the sales order. Select the Email Sales Order/Quote check box if during quick processing, the system must send the prepared sales order to the customer by email. In the Invoice Actions section: Select the Release Invoice check box if the system must release the generated Sales Orders invoice during quick processing. Select the Email Invoice check box if the system must send the generated Sales Orders invoice to customer by email during quick processing. Notes About the Procedure The notes in this section describe the nuances of the UI elements available on the form, such as when an element is required and when it is not, and when the system fills in settings by default. This section can include other notes. Note the following about the settings on the Quick Process Settings tab: The Close Order check box is available only if the Complete Order check box is selected. The Sales Order Actions section appears on the form only if the Sales Orders option button is selected under Generate Invoices In on the Preferences tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202300|FS202300]) Service Order Types (FS202300) form. The Prepare Invoice check box appears on the form only if the Use Sales Order Quick Processing check box is cleared. The Prepare Invoice check box is available if the Generate Invoice check box is selected in the Appointment Actions or Service Order Actions section or in both sections. The Email Sales Order/Quote check box is available only if the Generate Invoice check box is selected in the Appointment Actions or Service Order Actions section or in both sections. The Use Sales Order Quick Processing appears on the form only if the Allow Quick Process check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO201000|SO201000]) Order Types form for the order type selected in the Order Type for Invoice box on the Preferences tab of this form. The Use Sales Order Quick Processing check box is available only if the Generate Invoice check box is selected in the Appointment Actions or Service Order Actions section or in both sections, and the Prepare Invoice is cleared in the Sales Order Actions section. The Release Invoice and Email Invoice check boxes appear on the form only if the Use Sales Order Quick Processing check box is cleared. The Release Invoice and Email Invoice check boxes are available only if the Prepare Invoice check box is selected.

row.PlainText: Managing Staff Members In Acumatica ERP, you can define an employee of your company or a vendor as a staff member who can perform the services that your company offers to customers. The service management functionality helps you with keeping and managing all the information related to your staff members. This chapter describes how to manage staff member accounts and information related to staff members, such as skills, licenses, service areas, and schedules. row.column: Staff Members A staff member is a person who is responsible for delivering the services that your company offers to customers. Acumatica ERP provides you with ability to create, store, and manage information about staff members that helps you to select the correct staff member to perform a particular service. This information includes the relevant skills, licenses and certifications, location, and work schedule. In this topic, you will read about staff member types, the process of staff management, the creation of staff member data, and the ways you can monitor the staff members available for performing services. Understanding Staff Member Types You can create, keep, and manage information about staff members of the following types: Employee : A staff member of this type is an employee of your company. You use the ([~/?ScreenId=EP203000|EP203000]) Employees (EP203000) form to add, view, and edit an account for a staff member of this type. Vendor : A staff member of this type is a third party that your company engages to perform services. You use the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors (AP303000) form to add, view, and edit an account for a staff member. In Acumatica ERP, to create a list of staff members, you can enable existing employees or vendors as staff members, or create new employees or vendors that are enabled as staff members. You can view the list of staff members enabled in the system on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS205500|FS205500]) Staff (FS205500) form. Understanding the Staff Configuration Process To manage staff members in the system, you perform the following steps: Create a business account of the Employee or Vendor type on the ([~/?ScreenId=EP203000|EP203000]) Employees or ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors form, respectively. Enable the staff member account in the system. Optional: Enable notifications about appointments for staff members. Set up a work schedule. Specify skills and licenses for the staff member, if necessary. Specify service areas for the staff member, if necessary. Entering Employee or Vendor Data If your organization has only a small number of employees that are staff members, you can enter the employee data manually on the ([~/?ScreenId=EP203000|EP203000]) Employees form. For a larger number of employees, you can create an import scenario and upload the data from a file. For details on import scenarios, see Simplified Scenarios for Data Import. You can add a new staff member account of the Employee type by clicking the Add Employee button on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS205500|FS205500]) Staff form and entering the employee information on the ([~/?ScreenId=EP203000|EP203000]) Employees form (which the system opens). If your organization works with only a small number of vendors that provide services as staff members, you can enter the vendor data manually on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors form. For a larger number of vendors, you can create an import scenario and upload the data from a file. You can create a new staff member of the Vendor type by clicking the Add Vendor button on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS205500|FS205500]) Staff form, entering the appropriate vendor information on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors form (which the system opens) Enabling a Staff Member Account While you are entering the necessary employees and vendors (or at any later time), you have to enable them for use with the field services functionality as staff members. On the ([~/?ScreenId=EP203000|EP203000]) Employees form, you can enable the selected employee as a staff member by selecting the Staff Member in Service Management check box in the Service Management section of the form. On the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors form, you can enable the selected vendor as a staff member by selecting the Staff Member in Service Management check box in the Service Management section of the form. For each enabled staff member account, you set up the work schedule when the staff member is available for service, and you can specify the staff member's skills, licenses, certifications, and service areas, so the person can be selected appropriately to services. Setting Up the Available Work Schedule You can define the times when each staff member is available to provide services. You first define a staff schedule rule on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS202001|FS202001]) Staff Schedule Rules (FS202001) form and then generate a schedule for a specific period of time on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS500400|FS500400]) Generate Staff Schedules (FS500400) form. For details, see Staff Schedules. After you generate staff schedules, you can use the calendar boards to assign staff members to appointments or service orders that take place in time periods when the staff member is available for work. For details, see Appointment Scheduling Options. You can create rules for staff members of the Employee type only. Specifying Skills and Licenses If the services that your company offers require special credentials, you should specify the skills and licenses each staff member has. Before you start assigning skills and licenses to staff members, you should make a list of the required skills and license types, and enter them on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS200600|FS200600]) Skills (FS200600) and ([~/?ScreenId=FS200900|FS200900]) License Types (FS200900) forms, respectively. Then you can assign the needed skills when you configure a staff member on the ([~/?ScreenId=EP203000|EP203000]) Employees form. For details on skills, see Skills. You can assign needed licenses to a specific staff member directly when you create a new license on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS201000|FS201000]) Licenses form, or assign licenses to the staff member on the ([~/?ScreenId=EP203000|EP203000]) Employees form. For details on licenses, see Licenses. You can assign skills and licenses to staff members of the Employee type only. Specifying Service Areas You can divide the area where your company offers services into multiple service areas that are defined by ZIP codes. In this case, if a staff member can provide services only in specific service areas, you assign these service areas to this staff member on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS201900|FS201900]) Service Areas (FS201900) or ([~/?ScreenId=EP203000|EP203000]) Employees (EP203000) form. For details, see Service Areas. You can assign service areas to the staff members of the Employee type only. Enabling Notifications for Staff Members For each employee or vendor that you have set up as a staff member, you can select the Allow Appointment Notifications check box on the Summary area of the ([~/?ScreenId=EP203000|EP203000]) Employees or ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors form. With this setting, when a responsible person enters or changes details in an appointment, he or she can send an email notification to the applicable employee or vendor. Viewing Staff Members Defined in the System You can view the list of all the staff members that are defined in the system, along with basic information about each staff member, by using the ([~/?ScreenId=FS205500|FS205500]) Staff form. This form displays the following information about the staff members: staff member ID, name, type, branch, email address, and phone number. Acumatica ERP offers multiple options to help you ensure that the right staff member of your company performs each service. That is, if the staff member needs to have special skills or knowledge to perform a particular service, the system automatically suggests to you the list of staff members with the specific skills or licenses required for your service.{br}
In this topic, you will read about how skills are created in the system and then assigned to a staff member and to a service. ==Creating a List of Skills== Before you start creating a list of all the skills to be used for services by your company, you should gather information about the skills that are required for all of the services your company is going to perform. You then create the list of all required skills for performing services on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\FS_20_06_00|Skills] ([~/?ScreenId=FS200600|FS200600]) form. ==Assigning Skills to Staff Members and Services== Now that you have created in the system the list of all skills that may be needed for performing services, you need to assign the needed skills to appropriate staff members and to particular services. To assign skills to a particular staff member, on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\EP_20_30_00|Employees] form, you first select the appropriate staff member account. Then on the '''Skills''' tab, you add a row for each skill the employee has. For details, see [HelpRoot_FieldServices\FS__HOW_to_assign_skills|To Assign Skills].((({S:Hint}You can assign skills to staff members of the ''Employee'' type only. ))) You assign skills to services similarly on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\IN_20_20_00|Non-Stock Items] ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) form. You first select the appropriate service (that is, the appropriate non-stock item of the ''Service'' type). Then on the '''Service Skills''' tab, you add a row for each skill needed for the service. For details, see [HelpRoot_FieldServices\FS__HOW_To_Assign_a_Needed_Skill|To Assign Skills to a Service]. ==Related Articles== *[HelpRoot_FieldServices\FS__CON_Services|Services] *[HelpRoot_FieldServices\FS__CON_Staff_Members|Staff Members] *[HelpRoot_FormReference\EP_20_30_00|Employees] ([~/?ScreenId=EP203000|EP203000]) *[HelpRoot_FormReference\FS_10_01_00|Service Management Preferences] ([~/?ScreenId=FS100100|FS100100]) *[HelpRoot_FormReference\FS_20_06_00|Skills] ([~/?ScreenId=FS200600|FS200600]) *[HelpRoot_FieldServices\FS__HOW_To_Create_Skills|To Create Skills] *[HelpRoot_FieldServices\FS__HOW_to_assign_skills|To Assign Skills] *[HelpRoot_FieldServices\FS__HOW_To_Assign_a_Needed_Skill|To Assign Skills to a Service] *[HelpRoot_FieldServices\FS__HOW_To_Assign_Staff_to_SO|To Assign Staff Members to Perform Services] *[HelpRoot_FieldServices\FS__HOW_To_Schedule|To Schedule an Appointment on the Calendar Board]

Skills Acumatica ERP offers multiple options to help you ensure that the right staff member of your company performs each service. That is, if the staff member needs to have special skills or knowledge to perform a particular service, the system automatically suggests to you the list of staff members with the specific skills or licenses required for your service. In this topic, you will read about how skills are created in the system and then assigned to a staff member and to a service. Creating a List of Skills Before you start creating a list of all the skills to be used for services by your company, you should gather information about the skills that are required for all of the services your company is going to perform. You then create the list of all required skills for performing services on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS200600|FS200600]) Skills (FS200600) form. Assigning Skills to Staff Members and Services Now that you have created in the system the list of all skills that may be needed for performing services, you need to assign the needed skills to appropriate staff members and to particular services. To assign skills to a particular staff member, on the ([~/?ScreenId=EP203000|EP203000]) Employees form, you first select the appropriate staff member account. Then on the Skills tab, you add a row for each skill the employee has. For details, see To Assign Skills. You can assign skills to staff members of the Employee type only. You assign skills to services similarly on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items (IN202000) form. You first select the appropriate service (that is, the appropriate non-stock item of the Service type). Then on the Service Skills tab, you add a row for each skill needed for the service. For details, see To Assign Skills to a Service. ([~/?ScreenId=EP203000|EP203000]) ([~/?ScreenId=FS100100|FS100100]) ([~/?ScreenId=FS200600|FS200600])

Licenses A license is a document proving that a particular person has permission to perform work of a certain kind or has knowledge in a particular area. You first create license types, which are categories of licenses that are used for grouping licenses and associating a group of licenses with a service; you then enter all licenses (and assign license types to them when you enter them) that staff members or branches of your company own. You can then easily select the right staff member to perform a service for which special knowledge or permission is needed. In this topic, you will read about how license types and licenses are created in the system and then assigned to a staff member. Creating License Types Before you create the license types, you should gather the information about which license types are required for the services your company is going to perform, and identify their owner type. The license owner is the person or branch location to which the license was issued. There are two types of license owners: Business : You specify the Business owner type on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS200900|FS200900]) License Types (FS200900) form if the licenses of this type are issued to an entire branch location rather than to a specific person. For instance, you can record a partnership as a license type for a particular branch, so this branch can have the partnership, and other branches cannot. Staff Member : You specify the Staff Member owner type on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS200900|FS200900]) License Types (FS200900) form for a license type that is assigned to a staff member license (one issued to a staff member). While gathering information about the required licenses, identify whether each is valid in only a particular area or in all locations. You can specify the location where the license is valid in two ways: by specifying the service area, or by specifying the country, state, and city. For details on service areas, see Service Areas. For details on how to add licenses to the system, see To Add a License Type. You specify a license type for each license of a staff member or business that you enter into the system and assign the needed license types to services. When you select a staff member to perform a particular service of a service order or appointment by using the Staff Selector dialog box on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS300100|FS300100]) Service Orders (FS300100) or ([~/?ScreenId=FS300200|FS300200]) Appointments (FS300200) form, the system automatically suggests to you staff members that have licenses of the type that is necessary to provide the service. When you perform scheduling appointments by using calendar boards, you can filter the staff members by the types of the licenses that are needed for services. For details, see Assigning Staff Members and Appointment Scheduling Options. Creating Licenses of Staff Members For licenses issued to individuals, one license is owned by only one staff member, and each staff member can have multiple licenses. You can create licenses of staff members by using the following forms: ([~/?ScreenId=FS201000|FS201000]) Licenses (FS201000) ([~/?ScreenId=EP203000|EP203000]) Employees (EP203000) You can enter licenses of the Business owner type only on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS201000|FS201000]) Licenses form (that is, not on the ([~/?ScreenId=EP203000|EP203000]) Employees form). For details, see To Create Licenses. When you save a newly created license, the system assigns it a reference number in accordance with the numbering sequence assigned to licenses in the License Numbering Sequence box on the ([~/?ScreenId=FS100100|FS100100]) Service Management Preferences (FS100100) form. You can see the list of all the created licenses sorted by owner type on the Licenses (FS4020PL) form. Assigning License Types to Services To be able to select staff members for performing services based on the types of the licenses they have, you have to specify which license types are needed for each service. You can assign license types on the Service License Types tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items (IN202000) form. For details, see To Assign License Types to a Service.
